body_html:
@tobegit3hub we recently run a custom built tensorflow docker images successfully on Amazon Linux, which I believe is Redhat-based. Not sure if those are applicable to your case but we did:

  • Based on tensorflow/tensorflow:1.0.0-devel-gpu
  • Nvidia driver installed both on the host and container (same version). CuDNN is only inside the container though
  • Use privileged mode (not sure if you need this when using nvidia-docker)
  • Mount /lib/modules on the host to /lib/modules (this step is not needed on ubuntu, not sure why)

body:
@tobegit3hub we recently run a custom built tensorflow docker images successfully on Amazon Linux, which I believe is Redhat-based. Not sure if those are applicable to your case but we did:

- Based on `tensorflow/tensorflow:1.0.0-devel-gpu`
- Nvidia driver installed both on the host and container (same version). CuDNN is only inside the container though
- Use privileged mode (not sure if you need this when using `nvidia-docker`)
- Mount `/lib/modules` on the host to `/lib/modules` (this step is not needed on ubuntu, not sure why)
